channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023090251
item.description:
Report X-2023090251

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded when it was bumped off the rollers by another package being unloaded and fell onto the dock on the top part of the box causing one of the tops to become loose and leak DescribePack: One of the tops was loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the top was tightened down and the package was placed upright in a hazmat bag lined tote and taken to qa for processing

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PH was unloading and discovered leaking hazmat during AM sort DescribePack: Loose cap caused product to leak internally and externally DurationRel: 22 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was discovered QA was called to handle and put in hazmat tote to transport to QA

item.title: Report X-2023081947
item.description:
Report X-2023081947

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was being unloaded when it was discovered that one side of the box was wet and torn due to at least one leaking bottle top. The liquid damaged the box front so much that the box couldn't contain the other 3 gallons of liquid which have apparently fallen out of the box along the route to the QA area. When the box was discovered, it was brought to the QA area in a hazmat bag lined tote to be processed. DescribePack: There is a very large hole in the front panel of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The lid was tightened on the bottle.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at QA area already damaged due to internal leakage from loose caps DescribePack: loose caps causing internal leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed inside hazmat bag and yellow drum to be processed

item.title: Report X-2023090071
item.description:
Report X-2023090071

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: MESA
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED ABOUT A LEAKER HAZMAT IN THE PRELOAD OPERATION. WEARING THE APPROPRIATE PPE THE DESIGNED RESPONDER WENT TO THE LOCATION OF THE SPILL FOR CLEANUP, PLACING THE LEAKER IN A LINED SPILL TRAY AND UTILIZING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. THE RESPONDER THEN RETURNED WITH THE PACKAGE/DEBRIS TO THE DAMAGE CAGE FOR FURTHER INSPECTION.

DescribePack: the one bottle top leaked DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the bottle top was tightened down

DescribePack: Plastic bottle inside of box had a loose cap causing internal leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in plastic lined tote and removed from area

item.title: Report X-2023081786
item.description:
Report X-2023081786

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At approx. 830pm PST a package handler had notified me of a leaking package inside a drivers van, when I entered the vehicle the package appeared leaked on one side, the hazmat was placed in a damage tote promptly and taken to the assigned damaged hazmat area of my building. DescribePack: Upon initial inspection it appeared the cap of the inner packing was loose, there was also about 1/8th of the liquid was missing from the container, presumably from it leaking out. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: First the damaged hazmat was taken to the assigned damage area, once secured the area of the van was wiped down wherever the package leaked on. No packages were damaged and when I discovered it, it appeared the driver left the package in an upright position so it wouldn't leak further.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at QA leaking due to broken glass content. I placed package in a hazmat bag then in a yellow drum, also use absorbing pads to cleaned up spillage. DescribePack: Package lacked from inner and outer packaging causing it to break. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I placed package in a hazmat bag then in a yellow drum, also use absorbing pads to cleaned up spillage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG LEFT AT HAZMAT CAGE FOR HAZMAT TRAINED QA. PKG CAME OUT OF 869-GDRS-N TRAILER 452118 WET FROM ANOTHER DAMAGED HAZMAT PKG INSIDE TRAILER. THE BOX FOR THIS HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS DAMAGED AND HAZMAT PKGS CANNOT BE REPACKED DescribePack: NO DAMAGE TO CONTENTS INSIDE PACKAGE. ONLY DAMAGE WAS TO EXTERNAL BOX DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: IN HOUSE CLEAN UP

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of one coat green (un2922) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the inner poly 1 gallon can had released 1 cup of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
